0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• insulin degludec has centralized marketing authorization by the European Medicines Agency for use in the European Union for the treatment of diabetes mellitus in adults
  • insulin degludec is available in strengths of 100 units/mL and 200 units/mL; delivery device counters display number of units regardless of strength; dose conversion between strengths is not necessary
  • 1 unit of insulin degludec corresponds with 1 international unit of human insulin, 1 unit of insulin glargine, or 1 unit of insulin detemir
  • safety and efficacy have not been established in patients younger than 18 years
  • Type 1 diabetes mellitus: administer SUBQ once daily, preferably at the same time every day; use with mealtime insulin; individualize dose based on fasting plasma glucose levels (European Medicines Agency approved dosing)
  • Type 2 diabetes mellitus: initial, 10 units SUBQ once daily, preferably at the same time every day; individualize dose based on fasting plasma glucose levels (European Medicines Agency approved dosing).

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Type 1 diabetes mellitus
  • Type 2 diabetes mellitus

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to insulin degludec or any product component

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• adrenal, pituitary, or thyroid disease; increased risk of hypoglycemia; dose adjustment may be necessary
  • alcohol consumption; may intensify or reduce effect of insulin
  • cardiac failure has been reported with concomitant pioglitazone use; increased risk in patients with preexisting cardiac risk factors; monitoring recommended; treatment discontinuation of pioglitazone may be required
  • change in diet or physical activity; increased risk of hypoglycemia; monitoring and dose adjustment may be necessary
  • change in insulin type, brand, or manufacturer; dose adjustment may be necessary
  • diabetic retinopathy; abrupt improvement in glycemic control may lead to temporary worsening of condition
  • elderly patients; intensified blood glucose monitoring recommended; dose adjustment may be required
  • hepatic disease; intensified blood glucose monitoring recommended; dose adjustment may be required
  • hyperglycemia with potential progression to diabetic ketoacidosis may occur, especially in patients with type 1 diabetes; treatment for severe cases or dose adjustment may be required
  • hypoglycemia has been reported; usual warning symptoms may be altered in patients with long-term disease or greatly improved glucose control; dose adjustment may be necessary
  • illness, infection, or fever; increased risk of hypo- or hyperglycemia; dose adjustment may be necessary
  • insulin antibody formation may occur; increased risk of hyper- or hypoglycemia; dose adjustment may be required
  • IV or IM use and use in insulin pumps not recommended
  • pregnancy; intensified blood glucose control and monitoring recommended when considering pregnancy and during gestation
  • renal disease; intensified blood glucose monitoring recommended; dose adjustment may be required

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Dermatologic:Injection site reaction (1% to less than 10%)
Serious
  • Cardiovascular:Heart failure
  • Endocrine metabolic:Hyperglycemia, Hypoglycemia (10% or more)
  • Immunologic:Hypersensitivity reaction (0.01% to less than 0.1%)

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    not for IV or IM use or for use in insulin infusion pumps
  • Subcutaneous
    • administer subQ by injection into the upper arm, thigh, or abdominal wall
    • rotate injection sites within same region
    • use within 8 weeks of opening; do not refrigerate after opening
    • do not share insulin pens or cartridges among patients because of the risk of transmission of hepatitis viruses, HIV, or other bloodborne pathogens; use of a new disposable pen needle does not mitigate risks
    • a flexible dosing schedule is allowed; however, allow at least 8 hours between injections
